{"blocks":[{"key":"835bi","text":"Intracranial injections:  
Between 3 to 4 weeks prior to the experiments, we injected heterozygous DAT-Cre mice with the ASAP5f voltage sensor (AAV9-EF1α-DIO-ASAP5-WPRE). We injected the virus diluted to 1.92x1012 vg/mL bilaterally in the midbrain (1 μL per site).

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"4010c","text":"This protocol describes how to perform voltage sensor imaging from a population of striatal dopaminergic axons using high frame rates (600 Hz minimum) on coronal mouse brain slices. In particular, this protocol has been optimised for the use of ASAP5f voltage sensor (AAV9-EF1α-DIO-ASAP5-WPRE) from the Lin lab and changes in fluorescence are resulting from electrical stimulation.  ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":303,"length":7}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"49C1CB58B7ED47798D805A547EE72F4D","url":"https://linlab.stanford.edu/"}}}}

steps.section: Brain slice preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"f0b3t","text":"Sacrifice mice using cervical dislocation, exsanguination and decapitation. Quickly open the skull and collect the brain in an ice-cold slicing solution saturated with 95% O2/ 5% CO2, containing (in mM): 194 sucrose, 30 NaCl, 4.5 KCl, 1 MgCl2-6H2O, 26 NaHCO3, 1.2 NaH2PO4, 10 glucose.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":173,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":181,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":241,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":245,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":257,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":267,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":270,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9ev10","text":"Cut 300 μm thick coronal slices using a vibratome in ice-cold slicing solution saturated with 95% O2/ 5% CO2.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":99,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":107,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.section: Brain slice preparation
steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"d53pb","text":"Immediately transfer each slice to a beaker in a water bath at 32°C, the beaker filled with aCSF saturated with 95% O2/ 5% CO2, containing (in mM): 130 NaCl, 2.5 KCl, 26 NaHCO3, 1.25 NaH2PO4, 10 glucose, 2 MgCl2-6H2O, 2.5* CaCl2. Leave the beaker in the water bath at 32°C for 15 minutes. Then move the beaker to room temperature (20°C-22°C) for a minimum of 45 minutes before using the slices.  This protocol also works well with aCSF containing 2 mM CaCl2.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":117,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":125,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":175,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":186,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":189,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":210,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":214,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":227,"length":1},{"style":"sub","offset":456,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"31b2j","text":"","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3sdk","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"26acl","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"bkrbc","text":"The beaker containing the slices needs to be kept in the dark to avoid bleaching of the fluorescent sensor. We use foil to protect the beaker from light, or we use a beaker coated with a black opaque tape.  ","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

steps.section: Choosing acquisition settings and placing stimulating electrode
